Technical Overview

Explore the architecture, core components, and technologies behind CLAS.

Project Architecture

The CLAS platform is built on a modular architecture that ensures scalability, maintainability, and flexibility. It is divided into three main layers:

  • Frontend: Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, providing an intuitive and user-friendly interface.
  • Backend: Powered by Python with Django Framework for efficient data handling and business logic implementation.
  • Database: Uses PostgreSQL for secure and scalable data storage, ensuring efficient query performance.

Core Components

The platform is composed of the following core components:

  • Recipe Management: Handles uploading, editing, and managing recipes.
  • Search Engine: Advanced search and filtering based on keywords, ingredients, and categories.
  • Community Interaction: Includes comment systems, ratings, and feedback loops to foster collaboration.
  • Authentication: Secure login and registration using Django's authentication framework.

Underlying Technologies

The following technologies power the CLAS platform:

  • Frontend: HTML, CSS (with Flexbox and Grid), and JavaScript.
  • Backend: Django Framework (Python 3.8+).
  • Database: PostgreSQL for relational data storage.
  • APIs: Django REST Framework (DRF) for building RESTful APIs.
  • Deployment: Hosted on AWS EC2 with Docker for containerization.
  • Version Control: Git and GitHub for collaborative development.

Deployment Workflow

Below is an overview of the deployment workflow:

1. Clone the repository:
git clone https://github.com/your-repo-link/CLAS.git

2. Build Docker containers:
docker-compose build

3. Run the application:
docker-compose up

4. Access the application at:
http://localhost:8000
